intro: Phelypea sanguinea, commonly known as the bloodroot or red root, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, including South Africa, and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Phelypea sanguinea is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
